entry.title: HCM Brasil - Configuração de Naturezas Informativas de Rubricas do eSocial
entry.content:
Olá pessoal,

Estamos animados em compartilhar uma atualização importante que otimizar a gestão de eventos de rubricas informativas do eSocial para sua empresa. Com a nova funcionalidade "Naturezas Informativas de Rubricas do eSocial", você agora tem a flexibilidade de definir quais naturezas irão gerar eventos informativos S-1010.

O que é essa funcionalidade?

A funcionalidade permite que nossos clientes definam quais naturezas geram eventos informativos S-1010. Isso é feito através da personalização da visão Naturezas informativas de rubricas do eSocial (V_T7BREFD_NATINF). Com essa capacidade, as empresas podem ter um controle mais preciso sobre quais rubricas são reportadas como informativas ao eScoial.

Caso a solução existente atenda às necessidades de sua empresa, você não precisa customizar a visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF, o sistema irá gerar os eventos informativos S-1010 da maneira que sempre fez. O sistema considera todas as naturezas que começam com '99' ou os códigos específicos '4051', '6101', '1806', '1808' e '1810'. 

Configuração da visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF

Se a solução existente não atender às necessidades de sua empresa, você pode configurar a visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF informando TODAS naturezas classificadas como informativas. Certifique-se de configurar todas as naturezas utilizadas estaticamente pelo sistema, são elas: naturezas que começam com '99' ou os códigos específicos '4051', '6101', '1806', '1808' e '1810'.

Exemplo de configuração

Veja abaixo um exemplo de configuração da visão V_T7BREFD_NATINF, contemplando todas naturezas utilizadas estaticamente pelo sistema:

SAP Notes liberadas

Nesta entrega, as seguintes SAP notes foram liberadas:

  • 3559482 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3597076
  • 3597076 - Prerequisite objects for SAP Note 3559875
  • 3559875 - eSocial - S-1010 - Customization option to generate Informative events

Compartilhe sua opinião!

Estamos ansiosos para ouvir suas experiências com essa nova funcionalidade. Se tiver dúvidas, sugestões ou comentários, sinta-se à vontade para compartilhar na seção de comentários abaixo.

Não se esqueça de dar um Like neste post se você achou útil e compartilhá-lo com seus colegas. Siga a tag  HCM Payroll Brazil na SAP Community para se manter atualizado sobre as últimas notícias.

Acesse também nosso workzone exclusivo dedicado para informações sobre o eSocial e outras atualizações importantes.

Atenciosamente,

Guilherme Zenzen

entry.title: Re: SUM of sum formula - Crystal Report
entry.content:
Hello @YL1008 

You're trying to filter records based on the month from SHIPPER.SHIPPED_DATE, using a parameter like “January” or “February”. The formula field {@monthof} shows the month, but when you try to filter with:

{@monthof} = {?month of}

You get an error, totally expected. Crystal doesn’t always handle formula fields properly inside the Select Expert, especially when parameters are involved.
Here’s the reliable fix:

Create a string parameter
Call it ?month of, with static values from January to December.

Go to Report > Selection Formulas > Record and paste this:

Month({SHIPPER.SHIPPED_DATE}) =
Switch(
{?month of} = "January", 1,
{?month of} = "February", 2,
{?month of} = "March", 3,
{?month of} = "April", 4,
{?month of} = "May", 5,
{?month of} = "June", 6,
{?month of} = "July", 7,
{?month of} = "August", 8,
{?month of} = "September", 9,
{?month of} = "October", 10,
{?month of} = "November", 11,
{?month of} = "December", 12
)

That tells Crystal to match the numeric month from the shipped date against the name selected in your parameter. It’s much cleaner and avoids the formula field issue altogether.

Let me know if you want to also filter by year or need help showing the selected month on the report.

You can place ?month of on the report header to show which month is being filtered.
Important Notes

Do not use totext(month(...)) for filtering — it's fine for display only.

Do not use formula fields inside Select Expert if they depend on parameters — they may not resolve at runtime.

Let me know if you'd also like to filter by year, or want the formula to return a date range instead (e.g. from 01.MM.YYYY to 31.MM.YYYY).

StackOverflow examples where similar logic is applied: Filter Crystal Report by month string parameter 

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to separate the calculation of interes...
entry.content:
Hello @LeonardoMantilla 

It is not possible to separate interest and surcharge amounts in the standard interest calculation process in S4 Public cloud. The system calculates and posts a single combined amount to one G/L account.

Since enhancements like user exits are not available in Public Cloud, the logic cannot be modified. If separation is required, consider,

  • Manual reclassification after posting
  • Custom reporting logic to simulate the split

For long-term needs, you may submit a request via the SAP Customer Influence Portal.

Configuration for Interest Calculation-SAP help

Item Interest Calculation-SAP help 

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Permission issue creating development goals via API (...
entry.content:
Hello @Daniel_TabaresPavas 

Thanks for your detailed message.

The error you're seeing:

{
"error": {
"code": "NotAuthorized",
"message": "You do not have permission to create/edit the goal or group goal."
}
}

usually means that the user calling the API doesn’t have the right permissions to create a goal for someone else. Even though it works when the userId matches the caller, Success Factors applies stricter checks when you're acting on behalf of another user,  especially through the API.
What you can do:

Enable proxy permissions
Go to Manage Permission Roles and make sure the user making the call has:

Act on behalf of another user (Proxy Now)

"Proxy Now Permissions"

Check Goal Management permissions
In the same role, under Goal and Development Plan Permissions, they’ll also need:

Create, Edit, and View Development Goals

These should apply to the right target population (All employees or a defined group).

Confirm development plan access
Both the API user and the employee you're assigning the goal to must be assigned the same active development plan template.

Ensure API role access
The user also needs permission to use the OData API and Goal Management API endpoints.

Quick way to confirm:

If you log in as the API user and use "Proxy Now" to act as the target employee, try creating a development goal manually. If it works, the API should work too  assuming permissions and tokens are set up properly.

DevGoal-SAP help 

2091616 - How to grant Proxy permission only to Career Development Planning by proxy import - Career Development Planning 

3354229 - How to Grant Proxy Access to Users via ODATA API 

Configuring Goal Plan Permissions 

Let me know if it works

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: "Check In as New Version Not Possible" Error in Manag...
entry.content:
Hello @mbrewer 

The error Check in as new version not possible appears because you're trying to upload a new version using the wrong method.

In S/4HANA (2023), to create a new document version, you must use the Create New Version  button in the Manage Documents app. The "Check-in as new version" function only updates the existing file, it doesn’t create a new Document Info Record version.

This is standard system behaviour, confirmed in SAP KBA 3337480.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Supplier Visibility Control in Shared SAP Ariba SLP E...
entry.content:
Hello @S_MIRIYABILLI 

Yes, your scenario is supported in SAP Ariba SLP using a shared realm.

  • You can restrict supplier visibility by tagging suppliers with a custom field like Owning Company and using Purchasing Unit (PU) or Purchase Org mappings to control which users see which suppliers.
  • To allow shared visibility, tag common suppliers with a flag (Shared) and adjust visibility rules accordingly.
  • A multi-realm setup is only needed if strict data isolation is required, but it adds complexity.

This approach follows SAP’s best practices for visibility control in SLP.

Configuration Guide for SAP Ariba Supplier Management Applications on SAP Business Technology Platform 

Support Note KB0393360 

Best regards,

Chuma

entry.title: Extension Fields for Nota Fiscal Mapping
entry.content:
Businesses require customization to meet their unique needs. If you use the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you can add custom fields to support fiscal , providing enhanced flexibility for you.

What’s New?

This feature allows you to add custom fields to the fiscal document structure of supported documents using the Extension Fields for Nota Fiscal Mapping (NFE_CLOUD_EXTENSIBILITY) Business Add-In (BAdI).

This BAdI enables the addition of simple and complex data types (fields, structures and tables) at any point within the document structure, ensuring effective handling of dynamic data. This functionality is available for cloud landscapes, via Developer Extensibility, supported by ABAP for Cloud Development. 

Supported Documents

Currently, NF-e (Electronic Nota Fiscal), NFS-e (Electronic Service Nota Fiscal, specifically for São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro), and CT-e (Electronic Transportation Document) are supported.

Known Restrictions: You can add custom fields and structures using the Extension Fields for Nota Fiscal Mapping BAdI. However, you can't change the data already provided by SAP. Note that the new fields or structures you add only appear in the XML file if the Electronic Nota Fiscal (NFe) Authorize, Electronic Service Nota Fiscal (NFSe) and CTe Autorize APIs already support them.

Implementing the Business Add-In

The IF_NFE_CLOUD_EXTENSIBILITY interface is composed of the Add Fields for Nota Fiscal Mapping (ADD_FIELDS) method, which returns the ADDITIONAL_FIELDS parameter containing a structure with the new fields added to the end of the segment being processed.  

  • IV_DOCNUM: The document number that allows selecting document data from the Brazil Nota Fiscal Document Data CDS view.
  • ID_DOCUMENT: The structure of the document sent for approval.
  • IV_BR_NFECLOUDEXTNMODEL: The type of electronic document being processed (NF-e, NFS-e or CT-e ).
  • IA_SEGMENT: The segment data of the document for which you’re creating the implementation.
  • IV_SEGMENT_PATH: The path of the segment being processed.
  • CD_ADDITIONAL_FIELDS: The structure that returns the new fields added to the document.

Filters

For performance improvements and easy implementation, the Extension Fields for Nota Fiscal Mapping  BAdI has two filters:

  • Segment Filter (IV_SEGMENT_PATH): specifies the full path of the segment in the structure. For example, for the header segment, the IV_SEGMENT_PATH is "$.HEADER". Each document has a different root segment for the path of the structure being processed:
    • NF-e: J_1BNFE_S_AUTHORIZE_400
    • CT-e: NFE_CLOUD_CTE_MAP_AUTHORIZE
    • NFS-e RJ: IF_J_1BNFSE_TYPES=>TY_AUTHORIZE
    • NFS-e SP: IF_J_1BNFSE_TYPES=>TY_AUTHORIZE_SP
  •  NFe Cloud Extension Model (IV_BR_NFECLOUDEXTNMODEL): cloud extension model for which the BAdI implementation will be called. This parameter includes the NFe and NFSe filter values.

Known Restrictions: Currently, only NFS-e documents from São Paulo and Rio de Janeiro are supported.

Prerequisites

You have connected to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system in ADT (Eclipse-based ABAP development tools) and you're assigned to the DEVELOPER role.

How to Implement

You can create BAdI implementations through developer extensibility, which depends on filters.

1. Go to ABAP Development Tools (ADT) and create your own package. Make sure your package starts with Z in your namespace.

2. Create a new Transport Request for your package.

3. Choose the ABAP for Cloud Development Language Version.

4. Select the package you created, then choose New and Other ABAP Repository Object.

5. Select BAdI Enhancement Implementation and choose Next.

6. Enter a name that starts with the letter Z and if needed also your previously created package and find the Enhancement Spot that holds the released implementation.

7. Assign your BAdI Enhancement Implementation to an existing transport request, then the screen for the BAdI Enhancement Implementation appears.

8. Browse the BAdI you want to implement and enter a name for the implementation (starting with Z) and choose Add. 

This BAdI filters by segment path and model, allowing you to create separate implementations for each segment you need to extend.

Examples

Check the following examples on how you can structure your paths: 

  • Header of structure J_1BNFE_S_AUTHORIZE_400: PATH = "$.HEADER"
  • Issuer Address inside structure NFE_CLOUD_CTE_MAP_AUTHORIZE: "$.DOCUMENT_INFO.ISSUER.ADDRESS"
  • Prestador inside structure IF_J_1BNFSE_TYPES=>TY_AUTHORIZE: "$.INFRPS.PRESTADOR"
  • Endereço Tomador inside structure IF_J_1BNFSE_TYPES=>TY_AUTHORIZE_SP: "$.RPS.ENDERECOTOMADOR"

This enhancement empowers you to tailor  your documentation processes to better fit your operational needs.

Have you found this blog post useful? If so, choose “like” (kudos), share it with your colleagues, and follow me for similar content.

You are welcome to leave your questions and read similar blog posts on the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance SAP Community. Remember to follow the SAP Electronic Invoicing for Brazil (SAP Nota Fiscal Eletronica) and the SAP Document and Reporting Compliance community tags to keep up with the latest NF-e news.

Thank you, and until next time,

Luize

Configuration in Config Panel

 

After Transaction Execution in SAP backend.

entry.title: Expected behavior when defining duration for ONLINE items in bulk load via Item Connector
entry.content:
Hello Experts

We are using the Item Connector to load content into SuccessFactors Learning and need to correctly define items as ONLINE (e.g., e-learnings or videos).

Currently, when we specify in the load file:

  • CMPL_STAT_ID (online completion status)
  • CPNT_LEN (default content duration)

The system automatically classifies the item as BLENDED, which is not the desired behavior because the item should be strictly ONLINE.

We understand that the connector determines the item classification based on the following logic:

  • If neither CMPL_STAT_ID nor CPNT_LEN is provided → classification OTHER
  • If both CMPL_STAT_ID and CPNT_LEN are provided → classification BLENDED
  • If only CMPL_STAT_ID is provided → classification ONLINE
  • If only CPNT_LEN is provided → classification INSTRUCTOR LED

Questions:
What is the correct field or approach to specify the duration for an ONLINE item without the connector automatically classifying it as BLENDED?
Is there an additional parameter or recommended configuration for this case?

Regards

entry.title: [Solman]自社SolmanとSAP Solmanに同じ管理対象システムの登録は可能か
entry.content:
お世話になります。

 

現在、自社で導入しているSolmanシステムに51の管理対象システムを登録して連携・運用しておりますが、

これらの管理対象システムをノートDIGITS(SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP)に記載の

SAP Solmanシステムへ管理対象システムを移行しようとしています。

 

移行には数ヶ月かかる見込みですが、移行の期間中、自社のSolmanシステムの管理対象システム設定を

維持した状態で、ノートDIGITSに記載のSAP Solmanシステムに同じ管理対象システムを設定する

ことは可能でしょうか。

 

よろしくお願い致します。


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: [Solman]自社SolmanとSAP Solmanに同じ管理対象システムの登録は可能か
entry.content:
ご管理者様

平素は大変お世話になっております。

Diagnostics観点からみると、1つの管理対象システムについて、
複数個のSolution Managerシステムにより監視されます。

ノート207223に書かれている"SAP EarlyWatch Alert Processed at SAP"とは、
管理対象システムのSDCCNによりデータをSAPバックエンドに転送した後、
SAPバックエンド側で生成されるEWAレポートです。
そのため、貴社側Solmanシステムの管理対象システム設定を維持した状態で、
SAPバックエンドとつながっている場合、SAP側でEWAレポートが生成されます。

以上、宜しくお願い致します。
Haterm
SAPサポート

entry.title: Re: CSV Formatting on Mac
entry.content: Hi @bbknrt , Could you please try the following steps? Method 1: Open CSV File in Excel (Older Version) Start the Excel Application on your system. Go to the Data tab>>click on From Text and select the .csv file to open. Select the CSV file you downloaded earlier and click the Get Data option. Now, set the file Origin to Unicode (UTF-8) and enable the Delimited option. You must check the tab and comma options in the Text Import wizard. After that, click on the Next button. Click Finish to open and start viewing the CSV file data. Method 2: Open & View CSV File in Excel (Newer Version) Open Excel and go to the Data>> Select From Text/CSV option. Select the file you want to open from your system and click Get Data. Here, you will find the export.csv window. You need to set File as Origin to Unicode (UTF-8). Also, you need to set the Delimiter as Comma Finally, click the Load button.

entry.title: Alert Settings in SAP Cloud logging to Receive Notifications Whenever Conditions Are Met
entry.content:
Hi team, 

Could you tell me how to receive an alert each time the conditions in the CLS alert settings are met?

I created a monitor with the following conditions, but even if the conditions are met, an alert is only sent the first time, and nothing is done from the second time onwards.

 

<Create a monitor using the screen below>

 

<Alert condition>

  • Monitor details :   Select "Per query monitor" and "Extraction query editor" on the monitor creation screen. Schedule to evaluate condition at 1-minute intervals.
  • Data source :   index "metrics-otel-v1-*"
  • Query :   set to extract request error(response_status > 299) from 1 minute ago to the current time.
  • Trigger condition :   “ctx.results[0].hit.total.value > 0”

Regards.

entry.title: Effective way of doing an UPDATE with INNER JOIN in ABAP?
entry.content:
I have this statement in MS Access DB and I need to port it to ABAP:

 

UPDATE tableA
INNER JOIN tableB ON tableA.field1 = tableB.field1
SET tableA.field2 = tableB.field2
WHERE tableA.field2 IS NULL.
 
I can't figure out a "nice" way of doing this in ABAP without making it way more complicated than it should be.

What's your optimized way of doing this?
 
So far, this is what I have:

    DATA: lt_table1 TYPE TABLE OF table1.

    SELECT *
      INTO TABLE @DATA(lt_data)
      FROM table1
      INNER JOIN table2 ON
          table1~field1 = table2~field1
      WHERE table1~field2 IS NOT NULL.

    LOOP AT lt_data ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs_data>).
      <fs_data>-table1-short_id = <fs_data>-table2-short_id.
      INSERT <fs_data>-table1 INTO TABLE lt_table1.
    ENDLOOP.

    MODIFY table1 FROM TABLE lt_table1.

entry.title: Re: System metrics when CALM is integrated with FRUN
entry.content:
Dear Anita,

Thanks for your patience on this issue while I'm checking with developers across CALM and FRUN.  Please check my answers:

When you monitor a SF tenant in FRUN, CALM is just a proxy. We don’t persist the data in CALM. Data is only routed through CALM.

If you want to monitor the same tenant in SAP Cloud ALM, You need to turn on monitoring for the same tenant from SAP Cloud ALM. 

 

  • Turning on data collection in FRUN, means data is persisted only in FRUN.
  • Turning on data collection in CALM, means data is persisted only in CALM.
  • If you need it in both platform, you need to turn on in both platform.

In Your case, in /sdf/ALM_SETUP you need to setup 2 distinct destinations . One for CALM and One for FRUN.

Please let me know if you still got issue on this.

Best regards,

Ava Wang

entry.title: Understanding Terms of Payment and Contract Accounts in Solution Orders
entry.content:
Introduction

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition offers a versatile document type known as Solution Order. It allows businesses to sell a mix of products and services. These can range from physical goods to one-time services, long-term agreements, customer projects, and subscription-based services. In this blog, you're going to read about the determination of terms of payment in solution orders, when your Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA) is active for your payers, and when FI-CA is not enabled for your payers.

What Are Contract Accounts?

You can use contract accounts for payment processing and posting journal entries of business documents or transactions like solution orders. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you manage contract account master records for the Contract Accounting process. One key aspect in the process is the defining of payment terms (formally called "terms of payment"). Normally the system determines the payment terms in the documents according to the settings of your business partners.  

How To Maintain Payment Terms for Contract Accounts

You can follow these steps to maintain payment terms for contract accounts.  

1. Check the contract account that is used for a specific business partner.

Go to the Manage Contract Accounts app with the business role SAP_BR_APR_ACCOUNTANT_FICA. You can filter the contract account master data using the business partner such as 17100023. The system finds all the contract accounts with that business partner. You can choose one, CA_23 in our case, to view its details.  

2. Maintain the payment condition.

Go to the Contract Account Partners tab and select the business partner to see the details. Go to the Payments/Taxes tab, you can find the field Payment Condition. This field determines the payment terms when the contract account is used for a document, such as solution order. 

Note: The payer assigned to the business partner (BP) is used to determine the contract account in documents, such as the solution order. In this process, the system uses the payer from the BP to identify the contract account, you can select a contract account during document creation.

3. Set payment terms based on the payment condition.

To do so, you need the business role SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT on your user to access the Mange Your Solution app. Or you can directly find the configuration activity Maintain Payment Terms (ID: 102468) in your configuration environment. Double click on the payment condition which you maintained in your contract account, S001 in our case.  

Go to the field Terms of Payment under the Incoming Payments tab, you can select the one that you want to configure. In our case, it's S001.

Now, we have terms of payment S001 assigned to the contract account CA_23.

How To Maintain Payment Terms for Business Partners

1. Go to the Manage Customer Master app

You need the business role SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST on your user to access the Manage Customer Master app. Search for the business partner that you want to work on. In our case, we use 17100001.

2. Go to the Sales Areas tab

Go to the detail page of the business partner. Go to the Sales Areas tab and select the sales org that you want to work on. Here, we use the Sales Org 1710, Direct Sales 10, Product Division 00.  

3. Set payment terms for the sales area assigned to the business partner

Go to the Sales Area Details tab, you find the field Payment Terms. In our case, we specify 0004 for it. Note that it is different from that we set up for the contract account. 

How Payment Terms Are Determined in Solution Orders

There are two scenarios for determining payment terms: one involves using the contract account, and the other does not. The use of the contract account affects how payment terms are determined. 

1. Contract accounts used

In a solution order, once you input the sold-to party, the system determines the payer. A list of contract accounts then appears. You can select a contract account, and the payment terms are determined from the payer of that contract account.

For example: if the payer is 17100023 and the contract account is CA_23, the payment terms for contract account CA_23 are S001. See Step 3 of the section "How To Maintain Payment Terms for Contract Accounts" above. Therefore, the payment terms for the solution order is S001. 

2. Contract accounts NOT used

When the contract account isn't activated for the payer, the payment terms are determined directly from the payer of the business partner.

For example: if the payer is 17100001 and the contract account isn't used, the payment terms for the payer are 0004. Therefore, the payment terms are determined from the payer of business partner 17100001, making the payment terms 0004. See the Step 3 of the section "How To Maintain Payment Terms for Business Partners" above. 

Conclusion

In this blog, we explained the relationship between contract accounts and payment terms determination. Specifically, you learned about how contract account influences the source from which payment terms are derived. When you use the contract account in a solution order, the payment terms are determined based on the payer associated with the contract account. Conversely, if you don't use any contract account in a solution order, the payment terms are determined through standard method outside the contract account context, literally from the payer directly. Understanding this distinction is essential for accurate configuration and billing logic in the system. 

Additional Information

You can read about the feature from the SAP Help Portal:

  • Solution Orders 
  • Contract Accounting 
  • Contract Account (Master Data)

entry.title: Re: MIGO BADI in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Yashoratna,

after Post Goods Receipt then JE document will be create, you can try to trigger the event with these BADI for Journal Entry

The BADIs mentioned below are only available for use in the S/4Hana public cloud.

Business ContextBADIsDescription
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRYFIN_ACDOC_HEADER_VALIDATION Accounting Doc Header Validation 
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALIDATIONAccounting Doc Item Validation 
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_CODING_BLOCK_VALIDATION Coding Block Validation 
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_ACDOC_VALIDATION Accounting Doc Validation 
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_CO_SNDR_RECR_VALIDATIONCO Sender Receiver Validation
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRYFIN_ACDOC_HEADER_SUBSTITUTIONAccounting Doc Header Substitution
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_ACDOC_ITEM_SUBSTITUTION  Accounting Doc Item Substitution
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_CODING_BLOCK_SUBSTITUTIONCoding Block Substitution 
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCKFIN_ACDOC_SUBSTITUTIONJournal Entry Substitution
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCK，
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY_ITEM		FIN_ACDOC_EXT_SUBSTITUTIONJournal Entry Item Extension Fields Substitution 
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCK，
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY_ITEM		FIN_ACDOC_EXT_REV_SUBSTITUTIONJournal Entry Item Extension Fields Substitution For Reverse
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY, FINS_CODING_BLOCK，
FINS_JOURNAL_ENTRY_ITEM		FIN_ACDOC_EXT_CHG_SUBSTITUTIONJournal Entry Item Extension Fields Substitution For Change

For S/4HANA On-Premise Edition, please use following alternative solutions.

BADIsAlternative Solution
FIN_ACDOC_HEADER_VALIDATION Use Tool Validation(Tcode: GGB0) and Substitution(Tcode: GGB1)
or
Use Substitution/Validation Rules (Fiori App F4406)
FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_VALIDATION
FIN_CODING_BLOCK_VALIDATION 
FIN_ACDOC_VALIDATION 
FIN_CO_SNDR_RECR_VALIDATION
FIN_ACDOC_HEADER_SUBSTITUTION
FIN_ACDOC_ITEM_SUBSTITUTION  
FIN_CODING_BLOCK_SUBSTITUTION
FIN_ACDOC_SUBSTITUTION
FIN_ACDOC_EXT_SUBSTITUTIONUse BAdI: BADI_FINS_ACDOC_POSTING_EVENTS

FIN_ACDOC_EXT_REV_SUBSTITUTION

FIN_ACDOC_EXT_CHG_SUBSTITUTION

using this logic check for new document 

IF ACCOUNTINGDOCHEADER-ACCOUNTINGDOCUMENT NS '$' and ACCOUNTINGDOCHEADER-REFERENCEDOCUMENTTYPE = 'RMRP'.

ENDIF.

hoping this is useful for you.

Patrick

redis-cli --tls -c -p 6666 -a <password>

Below is the code.

It is also not able to establish connecttion and is stuck.

from redisvl.extensions.llmcache import SemanticCache

# Initializing a SemanticCache instance
llmcache = SemanticCache(
    name=cache_name_of_redis,                     # The name of the search index in Redis

    distance_threshold=value               # Similarity threshold for cache matching
)

entry.title: Re: High memory alert
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Metric "Used Memory[%]" is the amount of physical memory used on the host in percentage of total memory available.

This value is collected by SDA via saphostctrl GetCIMObject webmethod, thus you could use following command to verify the correctness of the received value:

./saphostctrl -function GetCIMObject -enuminstances "SAP_MetricValue?MetricDefinitionId=OS.FreePhysicalMemory&MetricDefinitionId=OS.AvailablePhysicalMemory&MetricDefinitionId=OS.TotalVisibleMemorySize"

Used Memory [%] = 100-(OS.AvailablePhysicalMemory*100/OS.TotalVisibleMemorySize)

Best regards,

Ava Wang

entry.title: Re: Multi-Tenant Audit Logging Fails for Subscriber Tenan...
entry.content:
Hi @Chris1973 ,

Thank you for your detailed explanation.

We are using centralized audit logging in the provider tenant. However, when a subscriber tenant modifies data, the CAP audit logging implementation (log2restv2) automatically tries to inject the x-zid header. This leads to a failure when obtaining the token (invalid_client), and as a result, the log cannot be published to the Audit Log Service.

Could you clarify the best practice for handling this case? Specifically, how should we log subscriber-originated events centrally while avoiding this token issue and ensuring proper multi-tenant audit logging behavior?

Best regards,
Agustino

entry.title: SLED/BBD not mandatory entry in MIGO for one plant but it is for the other although setting the same
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

I have a situation where SLED/BBD is a mandatory entry in MIGO when goods receipting (to purchase order) in plant A, but not when receipting in plant B.  I have been through the configuration requirements for plant and movement type.  Both plants are active for SLED check and movement type for 101 goods receipt is set to 1 - enter and check (in OMJ5).

Message 019 - "Enter the shelf life expiration date" (in message class 12) is configured as an error message.  It comes up if SLED/BBD is NULL in Plant A, but does not come up if it is NULL in plant B.

The material masters have the same settings for 'minimum remaining shelf life' in both plants (1 day for both).

Screen field settings in OMJX are not being used.  GOITEM-VFDAT is just set to 'input'.  

Materials are not batch managed.

Are there any other plant specific settings that I might be missing?  Note that plant B was created as a copy of plant A, including all the SLED relevant settings.

Thanks for your help

entry.title: Re: SLED/BBD not mandatory entry in MIGO for one plant bu...
entry.content:
• Even though the material master settings are the same at the plant level, check the Storage Location View for each plant. Go to MM03 → Plant Data / Storage 1. Ensure that SLED control is active for the storage location used in Plant B. If this view is missing or incomplete for Plant B, SLED may not be enforced. SAP may skip SLED validation if the storage location view is not maintained or if the storage location is not flagged for SLED control.
  • Sometimes, even if the material is extended to both plants, the storage location data may not be fully maintained for one of them. Use MM50 or MM01 to verify that the material is properly extended to the specific storage location in Plant B.
    Although you mentioned OMJX is not used, double-check the screen layout for movement type 101 in OMJJ. Ensure that VFDAT (SLED) is not suppressed or optional for Plant B. Compare the screen layout rules between Plant A and B.
  • If the PO used in MIGO has a default shelf life value from an info record or contract, it may bypass the SLED check in Plant B. Go to PO item → Delivery tab and check if Remaining Shelf Life is prefilled. Compare with PO used in Plant A
  • Finally, if Plant B was copied from Plant A, there may be custom logic or BAdIs that conditionally suppress SLED validation based on plant or storage location. Check for enhancements MB_MIGO_BADI or MB_DOCUMENT_BADI and look for any logic that skips SLED validation for specific plants

entry.title: Re: Find standard cds view for MBEWH SAP Public Cloud.
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA, the MBEWH table is no longer a physical transparent table. Instead, it is implemented as a DDL SQL view that selects data from a base table called MBV_MBEWH_BASE. This means you won’t find a standard CDS view named directly after MBEWH. But the system exposes MBEWH as a view, so ABAP code referencing it still works as expected.

What you can do is use the underlying CDS View by referencing the base CDS view or DDL source. MBV_MBEWH_BASE is the actual source of data and you can create your own CDS view on top of this if needed.
SAP recommends using the Query Browser to find standard CDS views. Go to Fiori Launchpad → Open Query Browser, search for views related to Material Valuation History where you may find views that join MBEW and MBEWH or expose historical valuation data

entry.title: Re: capacity scheduling table dispatch error: Order &1 is...
entry.content:
As per your post, you were getting two errors

  • "Order &1 is not consistent as it was modified externally"
  • "Order &1 could not be scheduled due to a technical error"

These errors typically occur when the production order was changed outside of the scheduling app, such as via direct table updates, custom programs, or other apps. The order is missing required scheduling data, or has inconsistent routing/work center assignments and if there’s a conflict in the pacemaker work center or capacity bucket used for scheduling.

What you can do is Check Order Consistency by using transaction COHV or CO02 to open the affected order and verify that the routing, work center, and production version are correctly assigned. Ensure no custom logic or external tool has modified the order fields directly.
If the order is corrupted or inconsistent, try releasing it again via CO02. If that fails, delete and recreate the order to ensure clean scheduling data.
The Capacity Scheduling Table only works with bottleneck operations assigned to a pacemaker work center. Check that the work center is correctly flagged in the production version. Ensure the operation is marked as a bottleneck in the routing.

Check this SAP  Help documentation for more details

entry.title: How to utilize SuccessFactors reports like canvas, story
entry.content:
Hi Team,

we want to know how to work on story and canvas reports in SuccessFactors modules like RCM , ONB, EC

entry.title: F2027: Manage Service Entry Sheets - PO reference dialog extension
entry.content:
Hi Experts!
I would like to ask, if it is possible to extend/change logic of displaying PO items in dialog box that appears after adding reference PO to the field and pressing ENTER.

I the list above, I would like to limit displaying items based on some conditions (deleted, blocked, limited..).
The CDS service of this app is not extensible. 
Adaptation project in BAS does not show extension:

Only adaptation editor can be opened, BUT the dialog is not extensible there either, as you can see, adapt UI is active, but only object behind the dialog are adaptable.

I have checked the BSP application, there are some extensibilities, and the one that I need, but as I can not see them in the BAS, is it even possible to implement custom logic to them? In my case I would need to work with SelectionDialogPO.fragment.xml  and controller for adding logic ListReportExtension.controller.js.


But, as the CDS are not extensible, I do not know.

Please help me find a correct solution.
Thank you ❤️
Veronika

entry.title: Re: Sales Based Rent Agreement in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Charlene,

You'll have to navigate to the Related Apps for "Manage Contract". There you will see the tab for Sales-Based Rent Agreement.

Regards, Andre

entry.title: Re: Sales Based Rent Agreement in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content: Hi Andre, currently there is no such tab for Sales-Based Rent Agreement. I think need to activate scope item 3F4.

entry.title: SAP Master Data Integration (MDI) – Bank and Cost Center Replication from S/4HANA
entry.content:
In continuation of my previous blogs on MDI Architecture and Deployment and Business Partner Replication, this post focuses on Bank and Cost Center replication from an SAP S/4HANA system to SAP Master Data Integration (MDI).

Master Data objects like Banks and Cost Centers are foundational across multiple systems. Enabling seamless replication to MDI ensures a harmonized master data landscape, supporting a clean core and extensible architecture.

Common Configuration Steps

Before configuring the replication-specific models, there are common prerequisites applicable to both Bank and Cost Center integration. These ensure secured, authenticated communication and connectivity between S/4HANA and MDI.

1. OAuth 2.0 Client Configuration

Use transaction OA2C_CONFIG to configure your OAuth 2.0 client. This allows S/4HANA to authenticate securely with the SAP MDI service.

2. Create RFC Destination

Use transaction SM59 to create a destination pointing to MDI, essential for connectivity.

3. Configure MDI Destination

Use transaction S_SAL_71000052 to access view V_MDI_DEST_CONF and configure your destination here.

4. BGRFC Configuration

Set up Inbound BGRFC Destinations using SBGRFCCONF. This ensures reliable communication for asynchronous data transfers.

5. Extract AIF Content

Run /AIF/CONTENT_EXTRACT with SAP_COM_0659 to extract the content needed for integration scenarios.

6. Publish OData V4 Services

Use /IWFND/V4_ADMIN to publish OData V4 service groups if not already done.

7. Create Technical User

Use SU01 to create a user that will be used for background processing and secure calls.

8. Assign Required Role

Clone the role SAP_CA_DRF_MDO using PFCG and assign it to the technical user created above.

9. Configure SAP BTP Destination

Ensure the destination is correctly set in the SAP BTP Cockpit pointing to your S/4HANA On-Prem system.

Cost Center Replication Setup

A. Push Model Configuration

Configure a push model to automatically send data to MDI when a Cost Center is created or changed.

B. Pull Model Testing

To validate the integration, use a REST client such as Postman to pull data from MDI after the Push model replicates it.

Sample replicated Cost Center data can be verified in Postman once changes are triggered from S/4HANA.

C. Output Test

Bank Replication Setup

A. Push Model Configuration

Similar to Cost Center, set up a Push Model for Banks to send data changes automatically to MDI.

B. Pull Model Testing

Again, Postman can be used as a mock target system to verify the successful pull of replicated bank data from MDI.

C. Output Test

Summary

With this setup, you’ve now enabled real-time or near-real-time replication of Bank and Cost Center data from S/4HANA to SAP MDI, supporting both Push and Pull models. This ensures data consistency across systems and promotes a modular, scalable enterprise data architecture.

Please note the Blog is to connect S/4HANA on-prem/Private Cloud system to MDI, there can be more scenario where the MDI would be then connected to other systems. For such scenarios, configuration is required in Master Data Orchestration or Business Data Orchestration.

More Blogs:
SAP Master Data Integration (MDI): Architecture, D... - SAP Community
SAP MDI: SAP S/4HANA Business Partner Replication using DRF Customizing - SAP Community
